feed.subtitle: Blog of Ragnarson, a Ruby and JS consultancy

entry.title: Founding Impact: Fashion, sustainability and sharing economy.
entry.summary: No one ever picked a product purely out of the impact story behind it.
entry.content:
No one ever picked a product purely out of the impact story behind it.

The impact story might have triggered attention to this brand or the product.

But at the end of the day you are putting your credit card in, because you like the product and you feel that it fits and it feels good.

This might sound exaggerated, but it totally makes sense when you think about it from the fashion perspective.

Our purchase decisions rarely depend on whether or not the product is sustainable, but looking at how the fashion industry affects the environment, it should change.

Our guest - Rune Orloff- decided to pursue the challenge of bringing sustainability to this sector and together with Kristian Rix, founded POOL - an impact rental service for high-end menswear.

In this episode, we uncovered the biggest challenges, difficulties, misconceptions and mysteries of the fashion industry.

Check it out to learn moreüëá

Check out our other videosüëá

entry.title: Founding impact: When do I need a CTO at my startup?
entry.summary: When is the best time to hire the CTO for your project?
entry.content:
When is the best time to hire the CTO for your project?

Is it at the beginning, when you‚Äôre looking for the product-market fit?

Maybe later, when your team grows a bit?

Our guest - Greg Ko≈Çodziejczyk heard this question from startup founders multiple times over the last few years.

Does he know the answer? Check out the latest episode of the Founding Impact podcast and find out!

entry.title: Founding impact: How business can help with nature conservation?
entry.summary: There‚Äôs a constant pursuit of new, innovative business models to bring new revenue streams to the nature conservation sector.
entry.content:
There‚Äôs a constant pursuit of new, innovative business models to bring new revenue streams to the nature conservation sector.

According to our guest - Adrian Dellecker, head of strategy and development at Luc Hoffmann Institute - it‚Äôs a massive challenge, but also a great opportunity for ambitious startup founders.

In this episode, he explained that regulations and government presence are not the only difficulties in the nature conservation area.

Kasia and Maciej had the pleasure to go on a deep journey through the challenges and opportunities around this topic and they invite you to join them by checking out the full episodeüëá

entry.title: Founding impact: sustainable supply chains
entry.summary:
Why exactly are supply chains so complex?

Why is it difficult to innovate them?
entry.content:
Why exactly are supply chains so complex?

Why is it difficult to innovate them?

To answer these questions we have to envision that even a simple product consists of many pieces.

All of them come from different suppliers, who again have their own suppliers that often change depending on price or quality.

This dynamic makes gathering and verifying data about the whole chain extremely difficult, sometimes even impossible.

Our guest Christian Dietrich specializes in bringing sustainability to supply chains.

In the latest episode, he told us about potential solutions and explained how to develop a sustainable supply chain.

Don‚Äôt miss out! Check out the whole episode!

entry.title: Founding impact: how to approach family office investors?
entry.summary: The society‚Äôs wealth in Poland started growing after 1989. That‚Äôs when many individuals had the chance to build and sell companies, becoming rich.
entry.content:
The society‚Äôs wealth in Poland started growing after 1989. That‚Äôs when many individuals had the chance to build and sell companies, becoming rich.

The next generations took over the family businesses and to keep growing them, started reinvesting their profits in other companies, startups, etc.

That‚Äôs how the first family office investors in Poland were established - and now they‚Äôre one of the most flexible groups on the market.

In the latest episode, Stanis≈Çaw Kastory - co-founder of the Firlej-Kastory family office investor firm - told the story of their investment journey to Maciej.

He also shared some details about how family offices work and advice on finding the best family office investor for your startup (as well as approaching and working with them).

It‚Äôs a must-watch for every startup founder looking for funding!

If you‚Äôd like to find out more, check out the whole episode!

entry.title: Founding impact: from marketing to impact investing - Kasia's story
entry.summary:
Every career path is different. Many entrepreneurs don‚Äôt know which way to go.

Even with the career path planned step-by-step, they sometimes ask themselves if what they do is really what they want to do.
entry.content:
Every career path is different. Many entrepreneurs don‚Äôt know which way to go.

Even with the career path planned step-by-step, they sometimes ask themselves if what they do is really what they want to do.

There‚Äôs a lot of uncertainty.

In this episode, Kasia shared her story of looking for the direction to pursue, with all the decisions, dilemmas and choices she made along the way.

If you‚Äôre an entrepreneur wondering which way to go, then you should definitely check out the whole conversationüëá
